question:
In MS-Excel 365, you can use _________ when you want to change a cell reference within a formula without changing the formula itself.

CHSL 2023 Tier-II
solution:
• In MS-Excel 365, you can use the INDIRECT function when you want to change a cell reference within a formula without changing the formula itself.
  • INDIRECT returns the reference specified by a text string, allowing dynamic cell referencing.
  • Other options like MATCH, VLOOKUP, and TRANSPOSE serve different purposes such as searching or rearranging data.

Additional Information:

  • INDIRECT is useful for creating formulas that adapt to changes in cell references dynamically.
  • It helps when you want to refer to different cells or ranges based on input without rewriting formulas.
  • Understanding INDIRECT enhances formula flexibility.

question:
Which of the following shortcut is used to close an open workbook in MS-Excel 365?

CHSL 2023 Tier-II
solution:
• The shortcut used to close an open workbook in MS-Excel 365 is Ctrl + W.
  • Pressing Ctrl + W closes the current workbook window without exiting the Excel application.
  • Other options like Ctrl + L, Ctrl + X, and Ctrl + C perform different actions such as select, cut, and copy.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + W is a common shortcut across many Microsoft Office programs to close the current document or window.
  • Knowing this shortcut helps in managing multiple workbooks efficiently.
  • Use Ctrl + Q or clicking the close button to exit Excel completely.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to make the contents of a cell underlined in MS-Excel 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key used to make the contents of a cell underlined in MS-Excel 365 is Ctrl + 4.
  • Pressing Ctrl + 4 applies or removes the underline formatting to the selected cell’s content.
  • Other shortcuts like Ctrl + 3 (italic), Ctrl + 2 (bold), and Ctrl + 6 (strikethrough) perform different formatting functions.

Additional Information:

  • Using keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl + 4 speeds up formatting tasks.
  • Underlining can emphasize important data in spreadsheets.
  • Knowing these shortcuts improves efficiency in Excel formatting.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to repeat the last command or action, if possible, in MS-Excel 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to repeat the last command or action in MS Excel 365 is Ctrl + Y.
  • Ctrl + Z is used to undo the last action.
  • Shift + Z and Shift + Y are not standard shortcuts in Excel for this function.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + Y is commonly known as the Redo command, which repeats or reverses the Undo.
  • This shortcut is useful when you want to quickly apply the same formatting or command multiple times.
  • Knowing the difference between Undo (Ctrl + Z) and Redo (Ctrl + Y) improves editing efficiency.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to start a new line in the same cell in MS-Excel 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to start a new line within the same cell in MS Excel 365 is Alt + Enter.
  • Tab + Enter does not create a new line inside a cell.
  • Shift + Enter moves the selection to the previous cell.
  • Ctrl + Enter fills the selected cells with the current entry but does not create a new line inside a cell.

Additional Information:

  • Alt + Enter inserts a line break within the same cell, allowing multi-line text.
  • This is useful for better formatting and readability of data inside a single cell.
  • Knowing this shortcut helps in organizing content efficiently in Excel sheets.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to make the contents of a cell italic in MS-Excel 365?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to make the contents of a cell italic in MS Excel 365 is Ctrl + 3.
  • Ctrl + 2 is used to make the contents bold.
  • Ctrl + 4 applies underline formatting.
  • Ctrl + 6 toggles between hiding and showing objects like comments and images.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + 3 quickly applies or removes italic formatting to the selected cell contents.
  • Formatting shortcuts like Bold, Italic, and Underline are essential for data presentation.
  • Knowing these shortcuts speeds up the formatting process in Excel.

question:
In MS-Excel 365, which of the following shortcut is used to copy the contents and format of the topmost cell of a selected range into the cells below?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key to copy the contents and format of the topmost cell into the cells below in MS Excel 365 is Ctrl + D.
  • Ctrl + C is used for copying selected data to the clipboard.
  • Alt + C and Alt + D are not used for this specific function in Excel.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + D is called the Fill Down command and is very useful for quickly copying data and formatting down a column.
  • It copies the content and formatting from the first cell of the selected range to all other selected cells below it.
  • This shortcut helps save time when entering repetitive data.

question:
Which of the following is correct option in MS-Excel 365, if a value in a cell of column A and row 10 is to be referred in a function or formula?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The correct way to refer to the cell in column A and row 10 in MS Excel 365 is A10.
  • A-10 is invalid because the minus sign is not used in cell references.
  • 10A is incorrect as the column letter always comes before the row number.
  • A:10 is not a valid cell reference format.

Additional Information:

  • Cell references in Excel follow the format: Column Letter + Row Number (e.g., A1, B5, C10).
  • This notation is used in formulas and functions to refer to specific cells.
  • Correct cell referencing is essential for accurate calculations.

question:
In MS-Excel 365 which of the following appears across the top of the screen and below the title bar and contains all the commands, formulas and features needed to create data-intense spreadsheets?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The Ribbon in MS Excel 365 appears across the top of the screen, below the title bar.
  • It contains all the commands, formulas, and features needed to create and manage data-intensive spreadsheets.
  • Status bar appears at the bottom of the window showing information like sum, average, etc.
  • Scroll bars help navigate through the spreadsheet.
  • Ruler is used in Word for measurement, not in Excel by default.

Additional Information:

  • The Ribbon is organized into tabs like Home, Insert, Page Layout, Formulas, Data, Review, and View.
  • It provides quick access to Excel tools and functions.
  • Knowing the Ribbon layout helps in efficient Excel usage.

question:
Each cell in the worksheet of MS-Excel 365 is identified by a cell ___________.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Each cell in the worksheet of MS Excel 365 is identified by a cell Reference.
  • Cell reference is the combination of the column letter and row number (e.g., A1, B5).
  • Rounding refers to adjusting numbers to a certain decimal place.
  • Color and Size do not identify cells uniquely.

Additional Information:

  • Cell references are used in formulas and functions to refer to specific cells.
  • Understanding cell references is fundamental for creating accurate Excel spreadsheets.
  • There are different types of references: relative, absolute, and mixed.

question:
Which of the following is Math and trigonometric function available in MS-Excel 365?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The ABS function is a Math and trigonometric function available in MS Excel 365.
  • Financial functions deal with financial calculations like interest rates, loan payments.
  • Text functions manipulate text strings.
  • Logical functions perform logical operations (e.g., IF, AND, OR).

Additional Information:

  • The ABS function returns the absolute value of a number, removing any negative sign.
  • It is widely used in mathematical calculations where only magnitude matters.
  • Knowing different function categories helps in using Excel formulas effectively.

question:
Consider the following statement about Match function of MS-Excel 2010:

P: It searches for a specified item in a range of cells, and then returns the relative position of that item in the range.

Q: The match function syntax is MATCH(lookup_value, lookup_array, [match_type])

R: All the arguments in a MATCH() function are required.

Which of the following statement(s) is/are true?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
option_1: Only P and Q
option_2: Only P and R
option_3: All P, Q, R
solution:
• Statements P and Q about the MATCH function in MS Excel 2010 are true.
    • P: MATCH searches for a specified item in a range and returns its relative position.
    • Q: The syntax is MATCH(lookup_value, lookup_array, [match_type]), where match_type is optional.
  • Statement R is false because match_type is an optional argument, not required.

Additional Information:

  • MATCH is used to find the position of a value within a range.
  • The optional match_type argument controls how Excel matches the lookup_value.
  • Understanding optional arguments helps write flexible formulas.

question:
Which of the following shortcut key is used to quickly create a new, blank workbook in MS-Excel 2010?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The shortcut key to quickly create a new, blank workbook in MS Excel 2010 is Ctrl + N.
  • Ctrl + W is used to close the current workbook.
  • Alt + Shift + N and Alt + Shift + W are not standard shortcuts for creating a new workbook.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + N opens a new blank workbook instantly.
  • This shortcut saves time compared to navigating through the File menu.
  • Familiarity with such shortcuts improves efficiency in Excel.

question:
What will the function given below return in MS-Excel 2010?

=MATCH(12,{10,13,30,40,60},1)

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• The formula =MATCH(12, {10,13,30,40,60}, 1) uses match_type = 1, which finds the largest value less than or equal to the lookup value (12).
  • The array is {10, 13, 30, 40, 60}, which is sorted in ascending order.
  • The largest value less than or equal to 12 is 10, which is at position 1 in the array.
  • Therefore, the function returns 1.

Additional Information:

  • When match_type = 1, the array must be sorted in ascending order.
  • If no value is less than or equal to the lookup value, it returns #N/A.
  • Understanding match_type helps in precise lookup operations.

question:
In MS Excel 365, which of the following charts shows the change of magnitude over a period of time?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• An Area Chart in MS Excel is used to display changes in magnitude over time ,emphasising the total value across a trend.
  • It is similar to a line chart but with the area below the line filled in, showing cumulative values .

Additional Information:

  • Line charts show trends but focus on points, not filled areas.
  • Bar charts compare categories, not trends over time.
  • Pie charts show percentage distribution at a single point in time, not across a timeline.

question:
In MS Excel 365, the VLOOKUP function is primarily used for:

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_2: searching for a value in a table and returning a corresponding value
option_3: finding the total of a range
solution:
• The VLOOKUP function is used to search for a value in the first column of a table and then return a value from the same row in another column.
  • It is useful for looking up data vertically in large spreadsheets.

Additional Information:

  • Syntax: =VLOOKUP( lookup_value , table_array , col_index_num , [ range_lookup ])
  • Commonly used for things like retrieving product prices, employee data, marks from student lists , etc.

question:
In MS Excel 365, how can you add a specific number of days to a date in Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Using the EDATE function
option_2: Using the DAY function
option_3: Using the WORKDAY function
option_4: Using the DATE function
solution:
• The WORKDAY function is used to add a specific number of working days (excluding weekends and optionally holidays) to a given date.
  • It is especially helpful in business and project planning to calculate end dates excluding non-working days.

Additional Information:

  • Syntax: =WORKDAY( start_date , days, [holidays])
  • For example, =WORKDAY( "01-01-2024", 5) returns the date 5 working days after 1st Jan 2024.
  • EDATE adds months, DAY extracts the day part, and DATE builds a date but doesn't add days directly.

question:
In MS Excel 365, to open an existing spreadsheet, which shortcut key is used?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, Ctrl + O is the shortcut key used to open an existing spreadsheet or workbook from your device or cloud.
  • It opens the file explorer orbrowse window.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + N creates a new blank workbook.
  • Ctrl + E is used for Flash Fill (auto-filling patterns).
  • Ctrl + I isused to italicise selected text or cell content.

question:
In MS Excel 365, which option arranges data in descending order based on the selected column(s)?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_3: Click the ‘Sort Z to A’ button
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, to sort data in descending order (from Z to A for text, or from largest to smallest for numbers), you use the ‘Sort Z to A’ button.
  • This arranges the data starting with the highest value or latest alphabet .

Additional Information:

  • ‘Sort A to Z’ is used for ascending order .
  • ‘Find & Select’ is used to search or select specific data.
  • The filter button is used to display specific rows , not sort them directly.

question:
In MS Excel 365, the COUNT function is used to ________.

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: count the rows in the dataset
option_2: count the numbers in the dataset
option_3: count the columns in the dataset
option_4: count the objects in the dataset
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, the COUNT function is used to count only the numeric values in a given range of cells.
  • It ignores text, blank cells, and logical values .
  • Example: =COUNT(A1:A10) will count only the cells with numbers in that range.

Additional Information:

  • To count both numbers and text, use COUNTA .
  • To count only blank cells, use COUNTBLANK .
  • For conditional counting, use COUNTIF or COUNTIFS .

question:
Which shortcut key is used in MS Excel 365 to enter a line break within a cell?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, pressing Alt + Enter allows you to insert a line break within the same cell .
  • This is useful when you want to display multiple lines of text in a single cell.
  • It improves data readability, especially in address fields or long notes.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + Enter fills the selected range with the same data.
  • Shift + Enter moves the cursor to the cell above.
  • Ctrl + Shift + Enter is used to enter array formulas (in earlier versions of Excel).

question:
Which feature in MS Excel 365 adjusts cells to fit contents automatically?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_3: Fit sheet on one page
solution:
• AutoFit in MS Excel 365 automatically resizes the column width or row height to fit the contents of a cell so that all data is visible.
  • It prevents text from getting cut off or hidden.
  • You can apply AutoFit from the Home tab→ Format → AutoFit Row Height / AutoFit Column Width .

Additional Information:

  • FittoCell is not a valid Excel feature.
  • Cellwidth is a general term, not a command.
  • Fit sheet on one page is used during printing to fit content to one page, not within cells.

question:
In MS Excel 365, how to address the cell in third row and fifth column?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel, columns are labeled with letters (A, B, C, ..., Z, AA, etc.) and rows are numbered (1, 2, 3, ...) .
  • The fifth column is column E , and the third row is 3 .
  • Therefore, the correct cell address is E3 .

Additional Information:

  • Cell addresses always follow the format: ColumnLetter+ RowNumber (e.g., A1, B5, D10).
  • “5A” and “3A” are invalid formats.
  • “35” refers only to a row number and does not include the column.

question:
In MS Excel 365, which shortcut opens the Print option?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, pressing Ctrl + P opens the Print dialog or Print Preview window.
  • It allows you to choose the printer, set page settings, and print the document.
  • This shortcut works across most Microsoft Office applications.

Additional Information:

  • Alt + P navigates to the Page Layout tab , not for printing.
  • Shift + P has no print-related function.
  • Ctrl + Alt + P is not a standard shortcut for printing.

question:
In Microsoft Excel 365, what is the cell address of column L and row 26?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel, a cell address is written in the format: Column Letter + Row Number .
  • Here, the column is L and the row is 26 , so the correct cell address is L26 .
  • This identifies the unique cell at the intersection of column L and row 26.

Additional Information:

  • L125 refers to row 125, not 26.
  • 125L and 26L are invalid formats and not used in Excel.
  • The correct and standard way is always letter first (column), then number (row) .

question:
In MS Excel 365, Contour map is an example of which chart?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A Contour Map is a type of Surface Chart in MS Excel 365, used to visualisethree-dimensional data in two dimensions .
  • It displays data as contour lines orcoloured zones , helping identify peaks, valleys, and gradients.
  • Surface charts are often used in scientific, engineering, or geographical data presentations.

Additional Information:

  • Scatter charts show relationships between two numeric variables.
  • Radar charts are used to compare multiple variables across a common axis.
  • Doughnut charts show proportions in a circular format, like pie charts.

question:
In MS Excel 365, default row height and column width?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, the default row height is 15 points , and the default column width is 43 characters .
  • These values are set automatically for every new worksheet unless manually changed.
  • The column width is measured based on the number of characters that can fit in the default font.

Additional Information:

  • Row height is measured in points (1 point = 1/72 inch) .
  • You can change both row height and column width manually using Format→ Row Height / Column Width under the Home tab.
  • Changing the font or zoom level can visually affect how content fits in the cells, but the default values remain the same.

question:
In Microsoft Excel 365, what is a function?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: A design tool for creating charts and graphs
option_2: A text formatting option for cells
option_3: A method to create animations in spreadsheets
option_4: A predefined formula that performs calculations using values in a specific order
solution:
• In Microsoft Excel 365, a function is a predefined formula used to perform specific calculations or operations automatically.
  • Examples includeSUM( ), AVERAGE( ), IF( ), VLOOKUP( ), etc.
  • Functions follow a specific syntax and take input values (called arguments) in a set order.

Additional Information:

  • Functions help simplify complex calculations and increase productivity.
  • They are typed starting with an equal sign (=) in a cell.
  • Excel provides hundreds of built-in functions for math, text, logic, date, and financial operations.

question:
In MS Excel 365, how can you set a specific print area in MS Excel?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: By changing the font size and style in the spreadsheet
option_2: By adjusting the page margins in the print settings
option_3: By applying conditional formatting to the data
option_4: By selecting the cells to be printed and defining the print area
solution:
• In MS Excel 365, you can set a specific print area by selecting the desired cells , then going to the Page Layout tab→ Print Area → Set Print Area .
  • This tells Excel to only print the selected range of cells instead of the whole worksheet.
  • It helps in controlling exactly what data gets printed , especially in large spreadsheets.

Additional Information:

  • Font size and style have no effect on print area selection.
  • Page margins affect page layout, not the print content range.
  • Conditional formatting is for visual data highlighting, not printing scope.

question:
If the custom format of a number is XX,XX,XXX then how will 4482023 be displayed in MS Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In Microsoft Excel, when you apply the custom number format ##,##,# ##, the digits are grouped from the right as: last 3 digits , then 2 digits , then 2 digits , and so on.
  • So, for 4482023 , it will be split like this: 44 (lakh), 82 (thousand), 023 (units)→ 44,82,023 .
  • This format is commonly used in Indian Numbering System .

Additional Information:

  • By default, Excel uses the International (Western) system: 4,482,023
  • Indian format (Lakh-Crore) requires custom formatting to show like: 44,82,023
  • To apply it: go to Format Cells→ Number → Custom → Type: # #,##,# ##

question:
What is the default alignment for text entered in Excel 365 cells?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In Microsoft Excel 365 , the default alignment for text data entered in a cell is left aligned .
  • On the other hand, numbers and dates are right aligned by default.
  • This helps Excel distinguish between text and numeric values .

Additional Information:

  • You can change alignment using the Home tab→ Alignment group .
  • Center alignment and Justify options are available for manual adjustment.
  • The defaultbehaviour ensures better dataorganisation and clarity .

question:
Excel 365 shortcut to copy selected cells for pasting to new location?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In Microsoft Excel 365, Ctrl + C is used to copy the selected cells or text to the clipboard.
  • After copying, you can use Ctrl + V to paste it to the desired location in the same or another worksheet.
  • This function allows duplication of content without removing it from the original location.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + X is used to cut the content (removes it from original location).
  • Ctrl + D is used to fill down the content from the cell above.
  • Ctrl + V is the paste shortcut.

question:
Which Excel 365 chart shows trends over time using points and lines?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A Line chart in MS Excel 365 shows data points connected by straight lines , making it ideal for displaying trends over time .
  • It is especially useful in time-series data , such as sales across months or temperature over days.
  • The lines helpvisualise changes, rises, or drops clearly.

Additional Information:

  • Pie chart is used for showing parts of a whole .
  • Column and Bar charts are used for comparing values across categories.
  • Line charts are preferred when the sequence or time aspect is important.

question:
In MS Excel 365, which feature is used to represent data graphically?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365 , the Charts feature is used to visually represent numerical data through graphs such as bar charts, pie charts, line charts, etc.
  • Charts help users quickly interpret patterns, trends, and comparisons.
  • They improve data presentation and decision-making.

Additional Information:

  • PivotTable summariseslarge datasets but doesn't use graphs directly.
  • Formula is for calculations.
  • Macro automates tasks, not for visual display.

question:
In MS Excel 365, correct sequence to insert a row?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Select the cell<<Left click<<Insert<<Entire Row
option_2: Select the cell<<Right click<<Insert<<Entire Column
option_3: Select the cell<<Left click<<Insert<<Entire Column
option_4: Select the cell<<Right click<<Insert<<Entire Row
solution:
• To insert a new row above a selected cell in MS Excel 365 , the correct method is:

    Select the cell→ Right-click → Click Insert → Choose "Entire Row" .

  • This inserts acomplete new row above the row that contains the selected cell.
  • Left-click does not open the context menu needed for inserting rows or columns.

Additional Information:

  • "Entire Column" adds a vertical column, not a horizontal row.
  • Shortcut for inserting row: Ctrl + Shift + "+" , then choose row.

question:
Basic syntax/symbol to execute a function in MS Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365 , every formula or function must begin with an equal sign (=) .
  • This tells Excel that what follows is a formula , not plain text or a number.
  • For example: =SUM( A1:A5) or =A1+B1.

Additional Information:

  • + is used within a formula but cannot start it.
  • : is used for cell ranges (e.g., A1:A5).
  • $ is used to indicate absolute referencing in cell addresses (e.g., $A$1).

question:
Function used to display current date in MS Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365 , the TODAY() function is used to display the current system date .
  • It updates automatically each day based on your computer’s clock.
  • Example usage: =TODAY() will show today’s date like 26-07-2025 .

Additional Information:

  • DATE() : Used to create a date from individual year, month, and day.
  • DAY() : Extracts the day part from a date (e.g., 26 from 26-07-2025).
  • MONTH() : Extracts the month part from a date (e.g., 7 from 26-07-2025).

question:
What is NOT done by Conditional Formatting in Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: We can delete condition if it is not required.
option_2: We can set condition to look for bold and apply italics on them.
option_3: We can apply font border and pattern formats that meet the specified conditions.
option_4: We can add more than one condition to format.
solution:
• Conditional Formatting allows formatting cells based on their values or formulas , such as applyingcolour scales, data bars, or specific fonts.
  • However, it cannot detect or evaluate font styles like bold or italics as a condition.
  • You can add, edit, or delete conditions and apply styles like fontcolour , borders, etc.

Additional Information:

  • You can access Conditional Formatting from the Home tab .
  • Rules can be created using logical formulas like =A1>100.
  • Multiple rules can be applied to the same cell.

question:
Shortcut to select entire row above current row in Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In MS Excel 365 , pressing Shift + Spacebar selects the entire row where your active cell is located.
  • This shortcut works regardless of which column you're in.
  • It’s useful when you want to format, delete, or insert rows quickly.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + Spacebar : Selects the entire column .
  • Ctrl + + : Inserts a new row or column (based on selection).
  • Alt + Spacebar : Opens the window control menu , not used for selection.

question:
Best data type for person’s first name in Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A person’s first name consists of alphabetical characters , so the Text data type is appropriate.
  • Text entries preserve leading zeros and special characters (e.g., hyphens, apostrophes).
  • Using Text prevents Excel from interpreting the name as a number, date, or currency.

Additional Information:

  • The Number type is for numeric calculations and will cause errors if used for names.
  • Date and Currency types apply special formatting, which is unsuitable for names.
  • Text alignment defaults to left-aligned , making names easy to read.
